column4: while upgradibg to dapper, it tries to remove xmkmf, together with a lot of stuff..
it also wants to remove hotplug >.>
you're doing dist-upgrade right?
dapper doesn't use xmkmf currently >.>
errors were encountered while processing locales_2.3.7-1_all.deb and all the language-pack-gnome
the version of Xorg that dapper uses doesn't need xmkmf
ok. I believe you. But anyway I'm stuck. No breezy and no dapper.
have you backed up your files?
I have fixed all things running aptitude instead of apt-get..
they are actually both doing the same just in a diff way
but with apt-get I was getting breaks during the upgrade. aptitude has a better dependencies control system.
in any case they are not the same. Look in the debian docs.
is there any known problem on dapper's package "locales"?
do you have something in mind?
no, it won't upgrade on my system
it doen't remove. Cannot remove old one.. maybe forcing?
I had to modify the preinst file in the locales .deb package to let it install.
it worked eh?
is italian firefox localization in dapper a known bug? It won't upgrade from breezy..
most firefox locales in dapper would cause your firefox to crash
just remove firefox locales and install/upgrade firefox
